entities: African Union Mission in the Sudan
summary:
The Security Council,
 Recalling previous resolutions, particularly 1590, and statements on Sudan,
 Reaffirming commitment to Sudan's sovereignty, unity, independence, and territorial integrity,
 Expressing sympathy on the death of First Vice President Dr. John Garang de Mabior and commending the Government of Sudan and First Vice President Salva Kiir Mayardit for peace efforts,
 Welcoming implementation of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) and formation of the Government of National Unity,
 Urging parties to meet CPA commitments, prioritizing establishment of the Assessment and Evaluation Commission,
 Determining the situation in Sudan remains a threat to international peace and security,
 Acknowledging troop-contributing countries' commitments to UNMIS and encouraging deployment,
Decides to:
1. Extend UNMIS mandate until 24 March 2006, with intention to renew;
2. Request Secretary-General to report every three months on UNMIS implementation, including work with African Union Mission in Darfur;
3. Urge troop-contributing countries to prevent sexual exploitation and abuse, ensure accountability, and take disciplinary action;
4. Remain actively seized of the matter.
